skill.name: debug-tauri
skill.description: Automates Tauri WebView debugging using official plugins (tauri-plugin-log + screenshots) with process verification, automated screenshots, console logs, and state analysis. Use when debugging Tauri apps, investigating WebView issues, analyzing runtime errors, or troubleshooting UI problems.
skill.summary: Automates Tauri WebView debugging using official plugins (tauri-plugin-log + screenshots) with proce...
skill.author: 8beeeaaat

security_audit.summary: This skill contains shell scripts for debugging Tauri applications. Scripts perform process verification, screenshot capture, and log analysis using standard system utilities. All capabilities align with the stated debugging purpose. No network operations, credential access, or data exfiltration detected.

content.value_statement: Debugging Tauri applications requires collecting screenshots, console logs, and WebView state manually. This skill automates the debugging workflow with official Tauri plugins for screenshot capture, log analysis, and state inspection across macOS, Windows, and Linux.
actual_capabilities: Verify Tauri app process is running
Capture application screenshots using official tauri-plugin-screenshots
Collect and analyze console logs with pattern detection
Capture WebView state including URL, title, and viewport
limitations: Requires tauri-plugin-debug-tools and tauri-plugin-log to be installed in the target app
Legacy macOS screencapture script is deprecated and macOS-only
WebView state capture requires debug permissions in app capabilities
Cannot debug apps without proper plugin initialization

use_cases.title: Debug runtime errors
use_cases.description: Collect screenshots and logs to diagnose crashes, UI glitches, and console errors in Tauri applications.

use_cases.title: Inspect WebView state
use_cases.description: Capture WebView URL, viewport dimensions, and user agent to troubleshoot rendering issues.

use_cases.title: Validate debug setup
use_cases.description: Run validation scripts to ensure logging plugins and screenshot permissions are properly configured.

prompt_templates.title: Capture debug snapshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug my Tauri app by capturing a screenshot and collecting recent console errors. Set TAURI_APP_NAME to the app binary name and run scripts/capture.sh.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze logs for errors
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze Tauri console logs for errors and warnings. Set TAURI_BUNDLE_ID to the bundle identifier and run scripts/analyze_logs.sh to identify issues.

prompt_templates.title: Validate debug setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate that the Tauri debug tools are properly set up. Run scripts/validate_setup.sh with TAURI_BUNDLE_ID to check permissions and plugin status.

prompt_templates.title: Full debug workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete debug workflow: 1) Validate setup with validate_setup.sh, 2) Capture screenshot with capture.sh, 3) Analyze logs with analyze_logs.sh, 4) Generate a debug report using the REPORT_TEMPLATE.md structure.

output_examples.input: Debug my Tauri app 'myapp' and collect console errors
output: - TypeError: undefined is not an object

best_practices: Initialize tauri-plugin-log at app startup for persistent log storage
Use official plugin API (captureMainWindow) instead of legacy screencapture script
Set TAURI_BUNDLE_ID environment variable for cross-platform log detection
Grant screen recording permission on macOS before running screenshot scripts
anti_patterns: Running debug scripts without verifying the Tauri app is running
Using legacy macOS screencapture instead of cross-platform plugin API
Skipping log analysis and relying only on visual inspection
Not configuring debug permissions in capabilities/default.json

faq.question: What Tauri versions are supported?
faq.answer: Requires Tauri v2.0 or later with tauri-plugin-debug-tools and tauri-plugin-log installed.

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Official plugins support macOS, Windows, and Linux. Legacy screencapture script is macOS-only.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my Tauri app?
faq.answer: Install the plugins, initialize logger in app startup, add permissions to capabilities, and use the APIs shown in SKILL.md.

faq.question: Is my app data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses log files and screenshots created by your app in temporary and user directories.

faq.question: Why are my console logs empty?
faq.answer: Ensure logger.initialize() is called at app startup and attachConsole() forwards console output to the plugin.

faq.question: How does this compare to browser devtools?
faq.answer: This skill captures app-level state and logs that browser devtools cannot access, including Rust backend logs and process info.
